definition: to say/to tell/to announce/to report/to denounce/to file a lawsuit/to sue

sentences.english: “IT'S good to talk”, says the snappy slogan of a British telecoms company.
sentences.chinese: “聊天真好”，这句俏皮的广告语源自英国电信。

sentences.english: Advertising language is a means for the addresser to attract the addressee.
sentences.chinese: 广告语是广告商用来吸引广大用户的一种手段。

sentences.english: The thesis explores the interrelationship between commercial slogans and pragmatics.
sentences.chinese: 探究商业广告语与语用学礼貌原则的关系。

sentences.english: A felicitous rhetoric mirage of advertisement language can enhance the salesmanship effect.
sentences.chinese: 恰当的广告语修辞幻象能够巧妙地增强广告的推销力。

sentences.english: EXAMPLE: Writers in advertising work hard to create new catchphrases for their clients' products.
sentences.chinese: 广告作家努力为客户的产品创作新的广告语。

sentences.english: Some slogans of the advertisements are quite funny and full of positive energy.
sentences.chinese: 它们的广告语一般都很有趣且充满正能量。

sentences.english: Meanwhile it is well-known that advertising discourse is highly goal-directed and communication-oriented.
sentences.chinese: 广告语篇的目的性和交际性都很强。

sentences.english: In the selection of personal pronouns, there exists some difference between English and Chinese advertising.
sentences.chinese: 同时，英汉广告语篇在人称代词的选择方面存在差异。
